A mother has appeared on This Morning claiming that she wants to medicate her son with cannabis. 
Hannah Deacon's five-year-old son Alfie suffers from a traumatic form of epilepsy, and is struggling to enjoy life on a day to day basis. 
His disorder has become so bad that he's unable to attend school, and he was rushed to hospital at 5am this morning due to another episode, which meant he had to miss the show. 
Hannah explained: "He's always in hospital for 2 or 3 days. Nothing has worked. It doesn't come easy to any mother to give their child drugs. None of these have evidence. Hannah is desperate for help (Photo: ITV) Her five year old is struggling with his epilepsy (Photo: ITV) Read More Nicola McLean's husband says she spent the day with a psychiatrist in unaired Celebrity Big Brother scenes 
"He can't go to school because he has steroid therapy. He can get aggressive so we have to be careful because other children don't understand it." 
In Amsterdam and America, treatment with cannabis is having huge impact on children suffering with the disorder, with many reporting incredible results after a short period of time. 
However, the treatment is illegal here in the UK, and incredible expensive to purchase online. She broke down in tears (Photo: ITV) He's not able to attend school (Photo: ITV) 
Hannah explained: "Medical cannabis is illegal in this country. It's quite controversial, and the laws need to be looked at." 
"We have tried to discuss it. I feel the conversation should be had. I've been in contact with many people who are seeing amazing results, and a huge reduction in seizures," she said. "We could go abroad, but my son is too ill to travel." 
Viewers rushed to agree with the pleading mother, with one insisting: "Yes cannabis should be legal if it helps medical conditions, like seizures, I 100% agree, if not use cannabis oils!!! #ThisMorning" Viewers sympathised with the mum (Photo: ITV) Dr. Ranj urged people at home not the buy their own treatments online (Photo: ITV) 
While another added: "I really Believe that Cannabis should be prescribed to those that have a serious medical need that could benefit from using it. #ThisMorning!" 
Despite sympathising with Hannah, Dr. Ranj urged viewers to not order treatment online. 
"We can't just dismiss things at face value because of history, but we have to be careful about finding our own products. 
"What he goes through, you wouldn't allow an animal to go through," insisted an upset Hannah. "It's horrendous. It's not right that it's allowed to happen." 
"We're desperate to give him the life he deserves," she added. poll loading Should the government legalise cannabis for medical purposes? 0+ VOTES SO FAR
